title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: thisplot R package providing utility functions data visualization plotting. includes tools color manipulation (blending, conversion, palettes), plot customization (themes, grob operations, patchwork building), panel size control, data optimization plots, layout adjustments. Designed enhance workflows ggplot2, patchwork, ComplexHeatmap.

title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: thisplot provides comprehensive Chinese traditional color system 1058 representative colors. Use ChineseColors() create color object, access colors name (pinyin Chinese), visualize collection visual_colors(), retrieve specific palettes using get_colors(). Example usage: keep GitHub README lightweight, HTML swatch output hidden . View full palette https://mengxu98.github.io/thisplot/reference/visual_colors.html run cc$visual_colors() locally.
code: library(thisplot) cc <- ChineseColors() cc #>  #> ── Chinese Traditional Colors System #>  #> ── Total 1058 colors #> • blue: 92 colors #> • cyan: 51 colors #> • gray_brown: 323 colors #> • green: 123 colors #> • orange: 92 colors #> • purple: 95 colors #> • red: 181 colors #> • yellow: 101 colors #>  #> ── Methods: #> • visual_colors(loc_range, num_per_row, title, name_type) #>  #> ── See also: #> • [get_colors()] for searching colors cc$visual_colors(   loc_range = c(1, 180),   num_per_row = 30,   title = "Chinese traditional colors",   name_type = "chinese" ) get_colors("Paired") title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: Install CRAN version: Install development version GitHub use pak:
code: install.packages("thisplot") # or if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("thisplot") if (!require("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak") } pak::pak("mengxu98/thisplot")

title: Utility Functions for Plotting
text: Please reference .

what: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: Blend two colors alpha channels using one several blending modes: blend, average, screen, multiply.

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
code: Blend2Color(C1, C2, mode = "blend")

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: C1 list containing first color RGB values alpha channel. C2 list containing second color RGB values alpha channel. mode blending mode use. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply". Default "blend".

title: Blend two colors using a specified mode — Blend2Color
text: list containing blended RGB values alpha channel.

what: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: Blend multiple colors alpha channels single color using specified blending mode.

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
code: BlendRGBList(Clist, mode = "blend", RGB_BackGround = c(1, 1, 1))

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: Clist list colors, color list containing RGB values alpha channel. mode blending mode use. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply". Default "blend". RGB_BackGround background RGB color composite . Default c(1, 1, 1) (white).

title: Blend a list of colors — BlendRGBList
text: numeric vector RGB values.

title: Chinese traditional colors system — ChineseColors
text: color system based Chinese traditional colors 1058 colors.

code: ChineseColors()

what: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: Convert RGBA (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) color RGB compositing background color based alpha channel.

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
code: RGBA2RGB(RGBA, BackGround = c(1, 1, 1))

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: RGBA list containing RGB values alpha channel. BackGround background RGB color composite . Default c(1, 1, 1) (white).

title: Convert RGBA color to RGB with background — RGBA2RGB
text: numeric vector RGB values.

what: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
title: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
text: Add grob gtable specified position (top, bottom, left, right).

title: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
code: add_grob(   gtable,   grob,   position = c("top", "bottom", "left", "right", "none"),   space = NULL,   clip = "on" )

title: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
text: gtable gtable object. grob grob gtable object add. position position add grob. One "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "none". space space allocate grob. NULL, calculated automatically. clip clipping mode. Default "".

title: Add a grob to a gtable — add_grob
text: gtable object grob added.

what: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
text: Convert color specified alpha level

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
code: adjcolors(colors, alpha)

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
text: colors Color vectors. alpha Alpha level [0,1].

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes specified alpha level.

title: Convert a color with specified alpha level — adjcolors
code: colors <- c("red", "blue", "green") adjcolors(colors, 0.5) #>        V1        V2        V3  #> "#FF8080" "#8080FF" "#80FF80"  ggplot2::alpha(colors, 0.5) #> [1] "#FF000080" "#0000FF80" "#00FF0080"  show_palettes(   list(     "raw" = colors,     "adjcolors" = adjcolors(colors, 0.5),     "ggplot2::alpha" = ggplot2::alpha(colors, 0.5)   ) )  #> [1] "raw"            "adjcolors"      "ggplot2::alpha"

what: Adjust graph layout to avoid node overlaps — adjustlayout
title: Adjust graph layout to avoid node overlaps — adjustlayout
text: Adjust layout graph prevent node overlaps considering node widths heights.

title: Adjust graph layout to avoid node overlaps — adjustlayout
code: adjustlayout(graph, layout, width, height = 2, scale = 100, iter = 100)

title: Adjust graph layout to avoid node overlaps — adjustlayout
text: graph igraph graph object. layout matrix two columns representing initial layout coordinates. width numeric vector node widths. height height constraint nodes. Default 2. scale scaling factor layout. Default 100. iter number iterations adjustment algorithm. Default 100.

title: Adjust graph layout to avoid node overlaps — adjustlayout
text: matrix adjusted layout coordinates.

what: Convert a plot object to a grob — as_grob
title: Convert a plot object to a grob — as_grob

what: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
text: Blends list colors using specified blend mode

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
code: blendcolors(colors, mode = c("blend", "average", "screen", "multiply"))

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
text: colors Color vectors. mode Blend mode. One "blend", "average", "screen", "multiply".

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes representing blended color.

title: Blends a list of colors using the specified blend mode — blendcolors
code: blend <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "blend"   ) ) average <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "average"   ) ) screen <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "screen"   ) ) multiply <- c(   "red",   "green",   blendcolors(c("red", "green"),     mode = "multiply"   ) ) show_palettes(   list(     "blend" = blend,     "average" = average,     "screen" = screen,     "multiply" = multiply   ) )  #> [1] "blend"    "average"  "screen"   "multiply"

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
text: Build gtable patchwork object arranging multiple plots according layout specification.

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
code: build_patchwork(   x,   guides = "auto",   table_rows = 18,   table_cols = 15,   panel_row = 10,   panel_col = 8 )

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
text: x patchwork object. guides handle guides. Default "auto". table_rows number rows table grid. Default 18. table_cols number columns table grid. Default 15. panel_row row index panels. Default 10. panel_col column index panels. Default 8.

title: Build a patchwork gtable — build_patchwork
text: gtable object.

text: dataset containing optimized traditional Chinese colors. colors extracted books: Chinese Traditional Colors - Color Aesthetics Forbidden City (ISBN: 9787521716054) Chinese Beautiful Colors - Chinese Culture Vol.3 (ISBN: 9781672897198) Chinese Colors (ISBN: 9787558016479) Chinese Journal Chromatography (ISSN 1000-8713) Chinese Color Atlas Thanks author blog providing data.

code: library(ggplot2) temp_nodes <- data.frame(   "x" = c(10, 40),   "y" = c(10, 30) ) data <- data.frame(   "x" = c(10, 40),   "y" = c(10, 30),   "xend" = c(40, 10),   "yend" = c(30, 10) )  ggplot(temp_nodes, aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_point(size = 12) +   xlim(0, 50) +   ylim(0, 50) +   geom_segment(     data = data,     aes(x = x, xend = xend, y = y, yend = yend)   )   ggplot(temp_nodes, aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_point(size = 12) +   xlim(0, 50) +   ylim(0, 50) +   geom_segment(     data = segements_df(       data,       shorten_start = 2,       shorten_end = 3,       offset = 1     ),     aes(x = x, xend = xend, y = y, yend = yend)   )

text: function displays color palettes using ggplot2.

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
code: show_palettes(   palettes = NULL,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   index = NULL,   palette_names = NULL,   return_names = TRUE,   return_palettes = FALSE )

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
text: palettes list color palettes. Default NULL. type type palettes include. Default "discrete". index indices palettes include. Default NULL. palette_names names palettes include. Default NULL. return_names Whether return names selected palettes. Default TRUE. return_palettes Whether return colors selected palettes. Default FALSE.

title: Show the color palettes — show_palettes
text: return_palettes TRUE, returns list color palettes. return_names TRUE (default), returns character vector palette names. Otherwise, returns NULL (called side effects display plot).

title: Simple random color selection — simple_colors

title: Simple random color selection — simple_colors

title: Simple random color selection — simple_colors
text: n number colors return. Default 10. palette name palette use. NULL (default), colors selected ChineseColors. Otherwise, colors selected specified palette. Available palette names can queried show_palettes.

title: Simple random color selection — simple_colors
text: character vector hexadecimal color codes.

title: Simple random color selection — simple_colors
code: simple_colors() #>  [1] "#EB3C70" "#5CB3CC" "#F0C2A2" "#2F2F35" "#602641" "#C8ADC4" "#EDF1BB" #>  [8] "#223E36" "#E9DDB6" "#5AA4AE"  show_palettes(simple_colors(n = 5))  #> [1] "1" "2" "3" "4" "5"  # Get colors from a specific palette simple_colors(n = 10, palette = "Paired") #>  [1] "#A6CEE3" "#CAB2D6" "#1F78B4" "#FDBF6F" "#E31A1C" "#B15928" "#33A02C" #>  [8] "#B2DF8A" "#FF7F00" "#FFFF99" simple_colors(n = 10, palette = "ChineseBlue") #>  [1] "#D0DFE6" "#106898" "#131824" "#BCD4E7" "#101F30" "#126BAE" "#66A9C9" #>  [8] "#22A2C3" "#1C2938" "#45465E" simple_colors(n = 10, palette = "Spectral") #>  [1] "#66C2A5" "#F46D43" "#3288BD" "#FDAE61" "#5E4FA2" "#ABDDA4" "#FEE08B" #>  [8] "#9E0142" "#D53E4F" "#E6F598"

what: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: Remove unused columns data ggplot patchwork object. function keeps columns actually used plot (e.g., mappings, aesthetics, facets), can significantly reduce object size original data contains many unused columns.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
code: slim_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'ggplot' slim_data(p)  # S3 method for class 'patchwork' slim_data(p)

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: p ggplot object patchwork object.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
text: ggplot patchwork object unused data columns removed.

title: Slim unused data in the plot — slim_data
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(   data = mtcars,   aes(x = mpg, y = wt, colour = cyl) ) +   geom_point() object.size(p) #> 368016 bytes colnames(p$data) #>  [1] "mpg"  "cyl"  "disp" "hp"   "drat" "wt"   "qsec" "vs"   "am"   "gear" #> [11] "carb"  p_slim <- slim_data(p) #> ℹ [2026-01-21 05:49:11] Vars_used: "mpg", "cyl", and "wt" #> ℹ                       vars_notused: "disp", "hp", "drat", "qsec", "vs", "am", "gear", and "carb" object.size(p_slim) #> 364944 bytes colnames(p_slim$data) #> [1] "mpg" "cyl" "wt"

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
text: function creates theme elements blank except axis lines labels. can optionally add coordinate axes plot.

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
code: theme_blank(   add_coord = TRUE,   xlen_npc = 0.15,   ylen_npc = 0.15,   xlab = "",   ylab = "",   lab_size = 12,   ... )

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
text: add_coord Whether add coordinate arrows. Default TRUE. xlen_npc length x-axis arrow "npc". ylen_npc length y-axis arrow "npc". xlab label x-axis. ylab label y-axis. lab_size size axis labels. ... Arguments passed ggplot2::theme.

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
text: list containing ggplot2 theme objects annotation objects. add_coord TRUE, returns list coordinate arrows; otherwise returns list theme .

title: Blank theme — theme_blank
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() p + theme_blank()  p + theme_blank(xlab = "x-axis", ylab = "y-axis", lab_size = 16)

title: Visualize colors in HTML widget — visual_colors
text: colors character vector hex color codes. names Optional. character vector names color. Default NULL, means hex color codes displayed. can pass labels (e.g., RGB values, custom names) via parameter. num_per_row Number colors per row. Default 30. title Optional title visualization. Default NULL.

title: thisplot 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2026-01-11 README: Converted static Markdown R Markdown (README.Rmd) dynamic content generation. Code examples now execute display actual output instead static images.

title: thisplot 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-12-17 check_ci_env(): New function detect current environment supports browsable HTML output. Now detects local pkgdown builds via IN_PKGDOWN environment variable knitr HTML output contexts. head.colors(): New S3 method colors objects, allowing use head() function limit number displayed rows (default n = 6L). visual_colors(): Integrated htmltools::browsable functionality. Added browsable parameter (default NULL auto-detection) automatically display widgets appropriate environments. Automatically detects interactive sessions GitHub Actions pkgdown workflow, preventing browser opening CRAN checks. ChineseColors$visual_colors(): Added browsable parameter support, consistent global visual_colors() function. get_colors(): Now automatically infers RGB values hex codes colors found palettes main dataset. Added internal hex_to_rgb() helper function convert hex color codes RGB format strings.

title: thisplot 0.3.0
text: get_colors(): New function search colors Chinese colors dataset available palettes. Supports searching palette names, color names (pinyin Chinese), numbers, hex codes. Automatically reports palette(s) contain found colors. print.colors(): New print method colors objects display color information ANSI color support terminal. Updated Chinese color system improved functionality.

title: thisplot 0.2.0
text: ChineseColors(): New function create Chinese traditional color system object 1058 representative colors extracted traditional Chinese color charts. Supports accessing colors name (pinyin Chinese), number, hex code, creating color palettes, generating segmented colormaps. visual_colors(): New function visualize colors HTML format grid color swatches, supporting optional names, RGB values, hex codes. get_chinese_palettes(): New function get Chinese color palettes organized color categories (blue, green, yellow, red, brown, purple, etc.) automatic continuous palette generation. chinese_colors: New data object containing 1058 Chinese traditional colors. Added comprehensive documentation Chinese color system functions. Updated package documentation include Chinese traditional colors feature.
